the right to life, liberty and security of person, and the relevant provisions

column16: Having regard to the legal framework of the mandate of the Special
column17: Rapporteur on extrajudicial, summary or arbitrary executions, including the
column18: provisions contained in Commission resolution 1992/72 of 5 March 1992 and

column24: Mindful of General Assembly resolutions on the subject of extrajudicial,
column25: summary or arbitrary executions, of which the latest is resolution 53/147 of
column26: 9 December 1998 in which the Assembly requested the Special Rapporteur to
column27: submit to it at its fifty-fifth session an interim report on the situation
column28: worldwide in regard to extrajudicial, summary or arbitrary executions and her
column29: recommendations for more effective action to combat that phenomenon,
column30: Recalling Economic and Social Council resolution 1984/50 of 25 May 1984
column31: and the Safeguards guaranteeing protection of the rights of those facing the
column32: death penalty annexed thereto, and Council resolution 1989/64 of 24 May 1989
column33:
on their implementation, as well as the Declaration of Basic Principles
of Justice for Victims of Crime and Abuse of Power, adopted by the
column34: General Assembly in its resolution 40/34 of 29 November 1985,
column35: Deeply alarmed at the persistence, on a large scale, of extrajudicial,
column36: summary or arbitrary executions in all parts of the world,
column37:
Dismayed that in a number of countries impunity, the negation of
justice, continues to prevail and often remains the main cause of the
continued occurrence of extrajudicial, summary or arbitrary executions in
those countries,
column38: Acknowledging the historic significance of the adoption of the
column39: Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court,
column40: Convinced of the need for effective action to combat and to eliminate
column41:
the abhorrent practice of extrajudicial, summary or arbitrary executions,
which represent a flagrant violation of the fundamental right to life,
column42: 1. Strongly condemns once again all the extrajudicial, summary or
column43: arbitrary executions that continue to take place throughout the world;
column44: 2. Demands that all Governments ensure that the practice of
column45: extrajudicial, summary or arbitrary executions is brought to an end and that
column46:
they tak ffective action to combat and eliminate the phenomenon in all its
forms;
column47:
3. Notes that impunity continues to be a major cause of the
perpetuation of violations of human rights, including extrajudicial, summary
column49: 4. Reiterates the obligation of all Governments to conduct exhaustive
column50: and impartial investigations into all suspected cases of extrajudicial,
column51: summary or arbitrary executions, to identify and bring to justice those

11. Requests the Special Rapporteur, in carrying out her mandate:
(a) To continue to examine situations of extrajudicial, summary or
column159: arbitrary executions and to submit her findings on an annual basis, together
column160: with conclusions and recommendations, to the Commission on Human Rights, as
column162: (b) To respond effectively to information which comes before her, in
column163: particular when an extrajudicial, summary or arbitrary execution is imminent
column166:
(d) To continue to pay special attention to extrajudicial, summary or
arbitrary executions of children and to allegations concerning violations of
column167: the right to life in the context of violence against participants in
column168: demonstrations and other peaceful public manifestations or against persons
column170: in defence of human rights and fundamental freedoms;
column171: (£) To continue monitoring the implementation of existing
